String: Increase accuracy for the next skill by 30. This can stack multiple times. The hit chance can reach 100%, overriding any effects that might otherwise limit the maximum hit chance.
Increase AP by X for this turn. Can only recover up to 6 AP per turn.
Act first in the next round.
Can't select ally because Character is selfish.
You already have an animal companion on the battlefield

{CHARACTER1} and {CHARACTER2} have steadily built up a trust and have now become friends. Amongst adventurers friendship is a valuable thing because there is nothing more reassuring than to have people around, who you can trust.

It was a bit surprising for everyone but these two have become lovers now.
The other adventurers around them didn't see that coming, so the two lovebirds had to go through a lot of embarrassing questions about their relationship. Despite that they seemed very happy together.

Sometimes a neutral relationship tips over to one side with just a minor thing. In this case somebody probably compared the other's mother to a troll while the other was dancing on their father's grave. Whatever it was, it probably wasn't minor.

It seems like these two have especially hit it well. So well in fact that they apparently already consider trusting each other their deepest secrets. They might be getting ahead of themselves with that decision. 
We'll have to see how this develops.

Lately when these two are together most of their conversation become arguments. Sometimes words would be thrown that are hard to take back. It's apparent to everyone that {CHARACTER1} and {CHARACTER2} don't like each other much. For now it's possible for them to work together when they have to but we have to hope that their relationship doesn't erode much further.
The party acquired the following items:
The following Adventurers join the Guild:
Every Party can only have a maximum of 6 Members. Choose your members wisely so that they can deal with any situation.
Tip: Adventurers in the same Party are more likely to interact with each other.
Don't hesitate to abandon a quest when it gets dangerous. Adventurers are expensive Investments.
Did you know you can specify a specific path while moving adventurers on the Battlemap? Hold Ctrl during the move action to set waypoints.
Divine magic works differently on undead. Healing Magic actually hurts them.
Ranged skills get an accuracy penalty if you're surrounded by enemies. Try to keep your archers away from the enemy.
Height matters! Hitting an enemy below you is easier than one who is above you.
Did you know you can undo a movement by right-clicking?
If enemies are hard to see behind terrain, try to change the visible height with the buttons on the right side of the battle screen.
Battles are too slow? You can change the speed of battle with the speed button in the left upper corner of the screen during battle. You can also bind it to a hotkey in the options menu.
Don't trust the dice? You can always see the rolls in the battle log. Look for the button on the right side.
Don't forget to use your BP in tough situations. There is no point in trying to save BP if your adventurers are about to die.

Did you know that the local blacksmith doesn't like magic?
So no enchanted weapons here.
